notes.text:
An update for postgresql-jdbc is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
PostgreSQL is an advanced object-relational database management system. The postgresql-jdbc package includes the .jar files needed for Java programs to access a PostgreSQL database.

Security Fix(es):

* postgresql: SQL Injection in ResultSet.refreshRow() with malicious column names (CVE-2022-31197)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
notes.title: Details

notes.title: Terms of Use

publisher.issuing_authority: Red Hat Product Security is responsible for vulnerability handling across all Red Hat offerings.
publisher.name: Red Hat Product Security

document.title: Red Hat Security Advisory: postgresql-jdbc security update

full_product_name.name: postgresql-jdbc-0:42.2.18-6.el9_1.noarch as a component of Red Hat Enterprise Linux AppStream (v. 9)
postgresql-jdbc-0:42.2.18-6.el9_1.src as a component of Red Hat Enterprise Linux AppStream (v. 9)

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an SQL Command ('SQL Injection')

notes.text: A flaw was found in PostgresQL. This flaw allows an attacker to benefit from a miss escaping character and leads to a SQL injection attack due to Java.sql.ResultRow.refreshRow() implementation from PGSQL.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: CVE-2022-31197 postgresql: SQL Injection in ResultSet.refreshRow() with malicious column names
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text:
User applications that do not invoke the `ResultSet.refreshRow()` method are not impacted.
Red Hat Fuse 7 is now in Maintenance Support Phase and details about its fix should be presented soon. However, Red Hat Fuse Online (Syndesis) does will not contain the fix for this flaw.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

If the postgresql service is running, it will be automatically restarted after installing this update.

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2022-31197 postgresql: SQL Injection in ResultSet.refreshRow() with malicious column names
